intro: Psacalium quercifolium, commonly known as the oak-leaved psacalium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its large, lobed leaves that resemble those of an oak tree, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the family Malvaceae.
